ygData.subject: Re: Banded Prices
ygData.msgSnippet: When I bought my banded armor, I was charged 15 plat per piece.  I though that was good since I was taking his time away from adventuring.  My friend paid
ygData.messageBody:
When I bought my banded armor, I was charged 15 plat per piece. I though
that was good since I was taking his time away from adventuring. My friend
paid close to the same prices for his armor. I think 20 plat is too high,
but anything around the 10-15 plat is good. Most people who need the armor
have the money to buy it at that price, and if not then they can piece a
suit together like I did.

Karudil the Wandering Shaman of Ro
17th Level <The Shadows>
Tarew Marr

----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 9:50 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banded Prices


> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> ore...free
> mold...few gold
> water...few silver
>
> cost of materials is only a couple of plat, so for someone to sell a few
gold above cost, the tunic would have to be no more than about 5
plat....i've never seen anybody selling that cheap. 10plat a tunic is still
a big profit, 20plat a tunic is a huge profit, anything above 20plat is a
rip off.
>
> > As for the fixed prices, I'm all for it. I haven't reached the level
where
> > I can make banded yet, but when I get there, I want more than a few gold
> > profit for my wares. I do have a further suggestion though. When you
see
> > people selling at a few gold above cost, bargain with them to get their
>
>
